name: Grand Hyatt Seoul

reviews.text: Spent three days at the hotel, on a business trip, so actually I spent only a few hours at the hotel. It is an excellent hotel in a privileged location on a little hill in the middle of Seoul. The room was very comfortable, and stylishly designed and furnished. So was the bed. The bathroom is outstanding in terms of design and amenities. There was a coffee maker in the room and a large size flat screen television with CNN and BBC. Everything was clean, in best order and worked immaculately, the only thing missing is an ironing board, but that will be delivered asap upon request. Laundry service fast and good. However, the room windows are sealed so you do not get a fresh breeze. The terrace adjacent to the lobby offers excellent views of the city and is open for breakfast and evening drinks. In the lobby there was a live music band in the evening that tried to be funky and that was a bit disturbing for conversation. There are a lot of smoking areas what I appreciated much as I smoke. For militant non-smokers that could be a bit surprising. Anyhow, the staff is helpful and friendly, check in and out is efficient and you will realize it is definity not a low cost hotel. Due to lack of time, I did not use all of the available infrastructure, but in any case, I would be happy to return to this place again.
reviews.title: Comfort and Relaxation

likes.liked: — The well equipped room and bathroom, the breakfast buffet,
likes.disliked: — not enough time to enjoy, the rather high price

reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Seoul for 2 weeks for business and really enjoyed my stay. The room was on the smaller side, with the furniture a bit older. And even though I was on a non-smoking floor, it still smelled of smoke. Well, it's Seoul so that was expected :) The bathroom was really small, though clearly recently remodeled. I particularly enjoyed laying in the super comfortable bed after a long day of meetings and looking out at the view of Namsan Tower.
reviews.title: Great business trip!

reviews.text: There are a lot of dining options, including a club downstairs. The prices, though, are ridiculously expensive. A cup of tea in the lobby lounge was a whopping 17 USD! The price of the food/drinks at the lobby lounge was worth the great ambience and amazing views of Seoul. Tip: if you're not already a Hyatt Gold member, sign up! You'll get daily complimentary morning coffee at etiher the lobby lounge or via room service. I don't know how much a coffee is but I'm guessing it's at least 15 USD.
reviews.title: Beautiful business hotel

reviews.text: Friday and Saturday nights can get a bit crazy. The club downstairs (JJ Mahoney's) is supposedly upscale with celebrities frequenting. All I saw were really pretty young things hanging on to the arms of their dates, who were old enough to be their dads or grandfathers. Whatever works for you.
reviews.title: Top Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the facilities available are great- full service spa, fitness center, upscale boutiques, and tons of dining options. The staff were extremely helpful and attentive at all times. Even though the location may not be the most ideal, the hotel offers complimentary shuttle service hourly from 10AM - 8PM (or so) to Itaewon (where you can hop in the subway), Myeongdong, and other locations. Plus, taxis in Seoul are crazy cheap so I didn't mind the location at all.
reviews.title: Lovely Atmosphere; Costly Experience

reviews.text: I loved the lobby, location, view of the Han River and especially the enormous thick towels in the bathroom. I stayed on the eleventh floor, by the way. Unfortunately the walls are very thin; conversations and coughs next door were perfectly audible, as was the neighbor's TV when it went on (at a reasonable volume) the next morning at 6 am. In went my ear plugs - but then I couldn't hear the maid when she barged in at about 9. The poor woman fled leaving the light on. I got up, turned it off, then took a shower, only to find the water pressure ridiculously low. When I checked out I complained about the thin walls, but the front desk clerk's smile never even slipped. Nothing is more infuriating than being asked how you enjoyed your stay, and getting your answer shrugged off with a robotic apology. I got the impression they just don't care. All in all, a whole lot of money to pay (especially with the strong Korean currency) for half a night's sleep and a weak shower. I would recommend that travelers either go downmarket to the Itaewon hotels or pay a teeny bit more for one of the luxury hotels in the city center.
reviews.title: great towels at least

reviews.text: This hotel is very expensive -- both the room price and restaurants/bars. (Restaurant lunch was about US$45!) Rooms are fine and location is pretty good (although not right downtown). There is a beautiful park right alongside -- great for morning runs. The gym is great. Parts of the hotel were loud -- but overall, I didn't have the same complaints as others on this website.
reviews.title: Very Expensive, but Great Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was here for a conference -- and conference facilities were good. Would stay here again -- but not on my own dime.
reviews.title: Needs an overhaul - don't stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Seoul for 2 nights in April and were really upset about the small, dingy rooms that are really in need of an overhaul. The beds were very small and hard. The bathroom was so small, that if you were on the toilet with the door open, you would bang your foot on the door. The hotel is on top of a hill and rather isolating and you need a taxi to get anywhere in town. The hotel does have a shuttle to Itaewon and Myeong-dong shopping areas which is convenient.
reviews.title: Renovating but lack of attention to detail

reviews.text: This is not a cheap hotel, and I have stayed in the luxurious Hong Kong Grand Hyatt with tempurpedic beds and large marble bathrooms, and expected a similar experience from this hotel. The one in Seoul certainly didn't live up to the Grand Hyatt experience. The public spaces also need a bit of updating I thought as well.
reviews.title: Great to visit, but not to stay

reviews.text: I went to seoul during the holiday weekend. The hotel was great. The rooms have been remolded, it now has a more "zen" feel. I must say that service is amazing, be careful though, there are a lot of places looking to take your money. I spent 35 dollars on a hair cut. I highly recommed it, I had plans to leave the city while I was there and I never left the hotel! Great Place!!
reviews.title: Great and Grand

reviews.text: Went to this Hotel for a Ball. Should have stayed at the Marriott!
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: we upgraded our room to the club level - which was nice to have a tea time, happy hour, and breakfast included, but it was PRICEY$$$. Our room was VERY small, and after many go-abouts we finally got a door that locked - but we could only have one key for the room. (guess we didn't want to go anywhere by ourselves anyways).
reviews.title: Nice American Owned Hotel in Seoul

likes.disliked: — The restaurants were quite expensive, though the food was good.

reviews.text: I used the beauty salon to have my hair done. PRICEY and honestly NOT worth it! 40000 won for a blow out - not even an up-do.
reviews.title: ok but expensive

reviews.text: I will do everythign in my power to not stay there again next year.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: I have only stayed here once, but I loved the place. Great views, good restaurants, great gym, great bar/nightclubs, and to top it off, for those of us who like to run, the mountain park across the street offers some good trails. I had an exec room for the weekend I was there and really enjoyed myself - to the tune of $300 per night, but what can I say.....it was fun.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Seould

reviews.text: I have a lukewarm relationship with this hotel but "despite everything" I always stay there when I stay in Seoul. Love the location as it's in an up-scale neighborhood on the outskirts of town, but dislike that it's so far from the city and business center. Love the coffeeshop and its menu of Korean and non-Korean dishes, but dislike that there aren't more alternative restaurants in the hotel. Love the views from the hotel, but dislike the too soft mattress and too heavy featherbed that make each night's sleep an ordeal. And the rooms are too warm in the winter (even adjusting the thermostat down as low as it goes) and the windows don't open. The Lobby is terrific--opulent and lively, but the guestrooms need more thought (like a shaving mirror in the bathroom, and a hot water kettle for in-room coffee/tea for starters). Why do I keep going back? For the beautiful russet-colored leaves in the autumn, the views of the green hills in the summer, the snow landscapes of the winter. . . and the excellent service-minded and friendly staff. If you stay in the hotel, know that right across the street from the main entrance driveway are two popular little bistro/restaurants, a 2-minute walk from the entrance. Ask the concierge for their names--pricey, but a good dinner alternative.
reviews.title: Much to like, but also room for improvement at the Grand Hyatt Seoul

likes.disliked: — Quality of the room and bedding

reviews.text: I stayed here for an industry meeting this month. I hadn't been to this hotel since their remodel. As others have pointed out, the rooms are a bit small, about the size of the regular rooms at the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. The bathrooms in Seoul are much smaller though - like that of a 4-star hotel in the US. The remodel does try to make the best of this space though.
reviews.title: Ok, but not very convenient

reviews.text: I stayed on the Club level and the breakfast layout was good, but not as good as Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. Espresso drinks are a serve-yourself affair from the machine.
reviews.title: A fantastic sophisticated hotel - everything you need and more!

reviews.text: The beds are quite firm - mattress on a wood platform. I have a TempurPedic bed at home, but here I hurt if I tried to sleep on my side.
reviews.title: Good but costly

description: Grand Hyatt Seoul, in the heart of the nation’s capital, is set amidst 18 acres of beautifully landscaped gardens at the foot of historic Mt. Namsan. Commanding breathtaking views of the Han River to the south and Mt. Namsan to the north, the hotel is only minutes away from the downtown commercial district and within walking distance of Itaewon, one of the city’s renowned shopping areas. The hotel is 70 minutes away from Incheon International Airport, 50 minutes from Gimpo Domestic Airport, 20 minutes from the Samsung-dong business hub, with most all of the city’s key districts within close proximity to the hotel.Hotel accommodations include 601 contemporary, luxuriously designed rooms and suites, using a selection of natural woods and fabrics to create a comfortable, residential ambience. The hotel hosts The Spa and Club Olympus recreation centre, a sanctuary of calm offering spa treatments, indoor & outdoor pools, tennis & squash courts and an ice skating rink.As a “multi-functional lifestyle destination”, cuisine plays a focal role at Grand Hyatt Seoul. The hotel boasts some of Seoul’s most magnificent 11 restaurants and bars, each showcasing its unique style and authenticity.
